sources.title: The Sphinx (1933)
sources.description: A man known to be a mute is suspected of committing a murder, as he was noticed at the scene. However, witnesses saw and heard him talking as he was leaving the scene of the crime. The police must determine if he is the actual killer or if he is being framed. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/the-sphinx-1933/

sources.title: The Sphinx (1933) - Colourised
sources.description: Film Noir from 1933 about a deaf and mute man accused of murder.

sources.title: The Sphinx (1933) [Colorized, 4K, 60FPS]
sources.description: The Sphinx is a 1933 black and white movie film which has been colorised, upscaled to 4K, and frames per second boosted to 60 FPS in 2022 using Artificial Intelligence (A.I) and Google Colab @  https://colab.research.google.com    Technologies used: A.I. Colorizing:  https://github.com/jantic/DeOldify  A.I. Increasing frame rate 60 FPS:  https://rife-vfi.github.io    A.I. Upscaling to 4K:  https://ffmpeg.org    GPU: Google Colab.  This movie is in public domain category and it is Copyright free.

sources.title: The Sphinx (1933) LIONEL ATWILL
sources.description:
Stars: Lionel Atwill, Sheila Terry, Theodore Newton
Director: Phil Rosen

A man known to be a mute is suspected of committing a murder, as he was noticed at the scene. However, witnesses saw and heard him talking as he was leaving the scene of the crime. The police must determine if he is the actual killer or if he is being framed.

sources.title: The Sphinx (1933) Adventure, Crime, Mystery
sources.description:
A man known to be a mute is suspected of committing a murder, as he was noticed at the scene. However, witnesses saw and heard him talking as he was leaving the scene of the crime. 

Director: Phil Rosen
Writer: Albert DeMond
Stars: Lionel Atwill, Sheila Terry, Theodore Newton
Genres: Classics, Adventure, Crime, Mystery
